main_definition: The navy refers to a country's maritime military branch, as well as the blue-green color associated with the sea.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Military organization responsible for naval warfare
meanings_and_examples.example: The British Navy is one of the largest navies in the world.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A dark blue-green color, resembling that of the sea or the ocean
meanings_and_examples.example: She wore a stunning navy dress to the event.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The fleet of ships operated by a country's military for defense and offense purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: During World War II, Germany had an extensive navy known as the Kriegsmarine.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A body of seafaring personnel who work in the maritime industry or on naval vessels
meanings_and_examples.example: He spent his entire career at sea with various navies around the world.
